metadata.title: USN-4415-1 -- coTURN vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Felix DÃ¶rre discovered that coTURN response buffer is not initialized properly. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2020-4067)  It was discovered that coTURN web server incorrectly handled HTTP POST requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service, obtain sensitive information or other unspecified impact. (CVE-2020-6061, CVE-2020-6062)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4415-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  coturn - 4.5.0.3-1ubuntu0.3 No subscription required
